column3: Success means having the courage, the determination, and the will to become the person you believe you were meant to be.
I have a lot of courage. I'm a realist.
Either life entails courage, or it ceases to be life.
The courage of a soldier is found to be the cheapest and most common quality of human nature.
Throughout the history of our young nation, we have seen our military go bravely into battle, armed with courage and willing to make the ultimate sacrifice.
People shouldn't look at me and think life is one big piece of glamour. That's the marketing, the spin. Life is challenging. But I have courage, strength, and enough good health to see the positive.
He who has courage and faith will never perish in misery!
Those who are rooted in the depths that are eternal and unchangeable and who rely on unshakeable principles, face change full of courage, courage based on faith.
In times of conflict, war, poverty or religious fundamentalism, women and children are the first and most numerous victims. Women need all their courage today.
Life is to be entered upon with courage.
Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.

Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.
People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.
Courage is the greatest of all virtues, because if you haven't courage, you may not have an opportunity to use any of the others.
He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.

It is my deepest belief that only by giving our lives do we find life. I am convinced that the truest act of courage, the strongest act of manliness is to sacrifice ourselves for others in a totally non-violent struggle for justice.
The only reason I'm in Hollywood is that I don't have the moral courage to refuse the money.
If one suffers we all suffer. Togetherness is strength. Courage.
Courage conquers all things: it even gives strength to the body.
Every man of courage is a man of his word.
The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves, or on whom she simply depends, is want of courage.
We are very much what others think of us. The reception our observations meet with gives us courage to proceed, or damps our efforts.
Real courage is knowing what faces you and knowing how to face it.
Whatever enlarges hope will also exalt courage.
It is our conduct, our patriotism and belief in our American way of life, our courage that will win the final battle.
But after this natural burst of indignation, no man of sense, courage, or prudence will waste his time or his strength in retrospective reproaches or repinings.
